alert.note: Alert for Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 4:25PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Pike County through 500 PM EDT... At 424 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Coleman, or 13 miles south of Williamson, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Paw Paw around 430 PM EDT. Board Tree, Phelps and Jamboree around 440 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Argo, Majestic and Woodman. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
